newsitem.title: BOTSWANA: STOCKS - DOMESTIC INDEX BREAKS 400 BARRIER.
newsitem.headline: STOCKS - DOMESTIC INDEX BREAKS 400 BARRIER.

text.p: Botswana's domestic index broke
the 400 mark barrier for the firt time ever to reach 407.29
points, up 8.49 points, in trading last week.
The index has now risen 16 percent in pula terms since the
start of the year.
On the domestic counter, brewery holding company
Sechaba increased trading by 10 thebe to close at 290
thebe, oil company Engen also added 10 thebe to end at
445 thebe and Standard Chartered Bank of Botswana put on
five thebe to close at 550.
Security group Inco shed 15 thebe to close at 85.
Trading unchanged were Botswana Insurance at 220 thebe and
miller and food wholesaler Sefalana at 440 thebe.
Barclays Bank of Botswana was well bid up to 625
thebe, but did not trade. Also untraded were First National Bank, investment company Kgolo ya Sechaba, food and
tobacco wholesaler Mestef and clothing chain Pep
Botswana Holdings.
Domestic turnover and value were down 271,201 shares from a
previous 788,505, changing hands to value 784,674 pula from the
previous week's 2.9 million pula.
On the foreign board De Beers traded 800 shares in
small lots and increased 172 thebe to end at 12,898. Regent
Undervalued Assets Africa Fund did not trade. The
Foreign Index put on 527 thebe to close at 396.33 points.
The All Companies Index closed 535 thebe up to reach 396.62
points.
